content:  cast on 40 stitches using smaller size needles 3 0mm 3 5mm or 4 0mm  join for working in the round making sure that stitches are not twisted  rib for 2-3 inches as follows knit 2 purl 2 repeat to end of row change to larger needle increase 10 sts evenly around for a total of 50 sts mitten body divide stitches as desired either for magic looping or for double points and marking beginning of row join for working in the round making sure stitches aren t twisted begin knitting from chart at row 1 on the right and join in with contrasting colour as charted the red line on the chart depicts the placement of the thumb it is on row 6 that the thumb chart begins work both the thumb chart and the mitten chart simultaneously begin thumb increases as indicated on chart on row 26 knit in pattern to thumb stitches take a piece of waste yarn and thread the thumb stitches onto the yarn cast on one stitch in the main colour over the gap and continue knitting in pattern this is the part of the mitten where the length may be adjusted by omitting or adding 4 row or more of the houndstooth check pattern begin decreases as charted on row 47 ideally mitten decreases should begin 3 cm below the tip of the middle finger after the last row cut both yarns leaving a 6 to 8 inch tail and using main colour thread the main colour through the remaining stitches twice turn the mitten inside out and neatly weave in ends thumb place thumb stitches onto larger needle the same needle used for mitten body and begin thumb chart picking up one stitch at the base of the thumb in the main colour as depicted on the chart once again the thumb length may be lengthened or shortened as desired by removing or adding row of pattern once the last row of the thumb chart has been completed cut both yarns leaving a 6 to 8 inch tail and using main colour thread yarn through the remaining stitches twice pull tight then turn mitten inside out and neatly graft in ends and any holes that may exist around the base of the thumb make one more mitten to match 4 | p age finishing turn mitten and thumb inside out weave in ends neatly if there are gaps at the base of the thumb weave a strand of main colour yarn through and around the gaps on the wrong side to close any holes make a second mitten block mittens as desired enjoy chart a- mitten body 5 | p age chart b- thumb 6 | p age
